    LonlineReport

    Lonline is a great tool to log your program into the cloud. This module provides methods to get the stored logs from your account in Dynamicloud.

    LonlineReport.fetch executes queries provided from Dynamicloud library and will fetch until 100 records by default, if you want to increase this, set the number of records in report_limit (log4j file)

    Additionally, LonlineRecord provides a method to count how many logs were printed in a specific time.

    Author:
    Eleazar Gomez

    • Method Detail

      • fetch

        public static void fetch(LonlineLevel level,
         java.util.Date from,
         java.util.Date to,
         LonlineReportCallback callback)
        This method fetches the logs according to level param and will be those created between from and to params. The results are decrease ordered by creation.

        How to use: 

         LonlineReport.fetch(LonlineLevel.ERROR, new Date(), new Date(), new LonlineReportCallback() {
      @Override
      public void manageLog(LonlineLog log) {
          System.out.println("log = " + log.getText());
      }
 });

        Parameters:
        level - level to be filtered
        from - from date if null will fetch all records equal to level in Dynamicloud
        to - to date
        callback - callback to manage logs

      • fetch

        public static void fetch(LonlineLevel level,
         java.util.Date from,
         java.util.Date to,
         java.lang.Class clazz,
         LonlineReportCallback callback)
        This method fetches the logs according to level param and will be those created between from and to params. The results are decrease ordered by creation.

        How to use: 

         LonlineReport.fetch(LonlineLevel.ERROR, new Date(), new Date(), AdditionalInformation.class, new LonlineReportCallback() {
      @Override
      public void manageLog(LonlineLog log) {
          System.out.println("log = " + ((AdditionalInformation) log).getText());
      }
 });

        Parameters:
        level - level to be filtered
        from - from date if null will fetch all records equal to level in Dynamicloud
        to - to date
        clazz - this class represents the objects with additional information sent to Dynamicloud, this method will be used when the additional information is required to retrieve. If clazz is not a LonlineLog class an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        callback - callback to manage logs

      • count

        public static long count(LonlineLevel level,
         java.util.Date from,
         java.util.Date to)
        This method counts the logs between a specific time according to 'from and to' params

        How to use:

        Fetch how many logs were printed from a specific time. 

         count = LonlineReport.count(LonlineLevel.FATAL, new Date(), new Date());

 System.out.println("Count of logs" + count);
        Parameters:
        level - target level
        from - date from
        to - date to
        Returns:
        the count of logs regarding to target level and a specific time.
